instructions.1: Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
instructions.2: Remove fat from pork; cut meat into 2-inch cubes and roughly chop fat.
instructions.3: Mix together pork meat and fat with garlic, olive oil, orange peel, orange juice, salt, bay leaves, black pepper, cumin, cinnamon, and 5-spice powder in a large bowl until pork is coated completely.
instructions.4: Transfer mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Cover the dish tightly with heavy-duty aluminum foil, then place on a baking sheet.
instructions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until pork is fork tender, about 3 1/2 hours.
instructions.6: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Remove garlic, orange peel, and bay leaves from the baking dish. Transfer pork to a colander set in a bowl. Pour accumulated juices from the baking dish over pork. Return pork to the baking dish and drizzle with some accumulated juices.
instructions.7: Cook under the preheated broiler for 3 minutes. Drizzle more accumulated juices over pork and continue broiling until crispy, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer pork to a serving plate and drizzle with remaining accumulated juices.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the oven from Step 1 being used?
Is oven from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is bay leaves from Step 3 still available in Step 4?
Is bay leaves live after Step 5?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 5?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to use the oven in Step 5?
Can we bake (Step 5) and cook (Step 7) at the same time?
